alert.note: Alert for Perry (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 12:31AM CDT until March 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Buffalo River Near Lobelville affecting Perry County. For the Buffalo River...including Lobelville...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Buffalo River Near Lobelville. * WHEN...From early this morning to early Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Water inundates low lying areas and agricultural land along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 10.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 630 PM CDT.
